revision.text:
{{Wiktionary|digraph}} '''Digraph''' may refer to:
* [[Digraph (orthography)]], a pair of characters used together to represent a single sound, such as "sh" in English * [[Typographical ligature]], the joining of two letters as a single glyph, such as "Ã¦" * [[Digraph (programming)]], a group of characters used to symbolise one character * [[Digraph (mathematics)]], or directed graph, in graph theory * Digraph, component of a [[CIA cryptonym]], a covert code name * As language codes in [[List of ISO 639-1 codes|ISO 639-1]]
==See also== * [[Digraphia]], use of multiple complete writing systems for one language. * [[Digram (disambiguation)]] / [[Digramme]] * [[Bigram]] * [[Trigraph (disambiguation)]] * [[Multigraph (disambiguation)]] * [[Unigraph]]
{{disambiguation}}
